title: Prevent Trench Foot and Immersion Foot
brief: Keep feet dry to prevent painful cold-wet injury that can lead to gangrene.
steps: Step 1: Keep feet dry at all times - this is the primary prevention.
Step 2: Carry extra socks in a waterproof packet.
Step 3: Dry wet socks against your torso (back or chest).
Step 4: Wash feet and put on dry socks daily.
Step 5: Recognize early symptoms: pins and needles sensation, tingling, numbness, then pain.
warnings: Results from hours or days of exposure to wet conditions just above freezing.
Progressive damage: skin appears wet, white, shriveled, then red, then bluish-black.
Can lead to gangrene and may require amputation in extreme cases.
Nerves and muscles sustain the main damage.
